subject: Web3
title: Impermanent Loss
description: A short lesson to help you apply Impermanent Loss.

hook.text: Provide liquidity to a DeFi pool and you might earn less than just holding the tokens. It's called impermanent loss.

buildup.text: When you add tokens to a pool, the pool rebalances as prices change. You end up with more of the losing token.

discovery.text: If ETH doubles while you're in an ETH/USDC pool, you'd have been better off just holding ETH.

twist.text: The loss is 'impermanent' only if prices return to where they started. In volatile markets, the loss often becomes permanent.

climax.text: Trading fees can offset impermanent loss â€” but in many pools, they don't. Most liquidity providers lose money overall.

punchline.text: They called it 'impermanent' to make it sound temporary. Often it isn't.

quiz.question: What causes impermanent loss in DeFi liquidity pools?
options: The pool rebalances as token prices diverge, reducing your holdings' value
